Package io.github.noeppi_noeppi.libx.data.provider

Class BlockLootProviderBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.noeppi_noeppi.libx.data.provider.BlockLootProviderBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.minecraft.data.IDataProvider
    public abstract class BlockLootProviderBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements net.minecraft.data.IDataProvider
    A base class for block loot provider. When overriding this you should call the customLootTable methods in setup to adjust the loot tables. Every block of you mod that is left untouched will get a default loot table.

      • customLootTable

        protected void customLootTable​(net.minecraft.block.Block block)
        The given block will not be processed by this provider. Useful when you want to create the loot table manually.

      • empty

        public void empty​(net.minecraft.block.Block b)

      • copyNBT

        public void copyNBT​(net.minecraft.block.Block b,
                    java.lang.String... tags)
        Creates a loot table that copies NBT-Data from a tile entity into the dropped item. Should be called in constructor.
        Parameters:
        tags - The toplevel tags of the tile entity to be copied.

      • defaultBehavior

        @Nullable
protected net.minecraft.loot.LootTable.Builder defaultBehavior​(net.minecraft.block.Block b)
        Creates a default loot table for the given block. Can be overridden to alter default behaviour. Should return null if no loot table should be generated.

      • needsLootTable

        protected boolean needsLootTable​(net.minecraft.block.BlockState state)
        Returns whether this block state needs a loot table. If all blockstates of a block don't need a loot table, defaultBehavior will return null for that block. Can be overridden to alter the behaviour.
